Token.Abstract: The path object represents a valid Dropbox path, and knows how to do correct path comparisons. It also has convenience methods for constructing new paths.
The top-most folder in your app's view of the user's Dropbox.
Create a new path object from a string. Some special characters, names, or encodings a are not allowed in a Dropbox path. For more details see this [article](http://www.dropbox.com/help/145 ).

ReturnValue.Abstract: A new path object if the contents of pathStr are a valid Dropbox path, nil otherwise.

Token.Abstract: The unqualified name of the file or folder at this path. For the root, this will return the same as stringValue.
Create a new path by treating the current path as a path to a folder, and childName as the name of an item in that folder.

ReturnValue.Abstract: A new path, or nil if childName is invalid.

Token.Abstract: Create a new path that is the folder containing the current path. For the root, this will return the same as stringValue.

ReturnValue.Abstract: A new path, or nil if path is already at the root.

Token.Abstract: The fully qualified path (relative to the root) as a string, with original casing.
